scenarioDescription:
The KMT-2018-BLG-0029L Exoplanetary System


Overview

KMT-2018-BLG-0029L is a star with 1.14 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 11024.07 light years away from the solar system.

KMT-2018-BLG-0029L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KMT-2018-BLG-0029L system


KMT-2018-BLG-0029L b

KMT-2018-BLG-0029L b was discovered by the KMTNet observatory, in 2020-02, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 4.27 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KMT-2018-BLG-0029L b is 7.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KMT-2018-BLG-0029L b is 2.670 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, KMT-2018-BLG-0029L b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system KMT-2018-BLG-0029L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the KMTNet.
name: KMT-2018-BLG-0029L - System With 1 Exoplanet
